intro: Trichomanes acrocarpon, commonly known as the tall clubmoss, is a small evergreen plant belonging to the family Huperfamily. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, scale-like leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern. The plant produces spore-bearing structures called sporangia, which are typically clustered at the ends of the stems. Trichomanes acrocarpon is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and small invertebrates.
